SENT.plain: Behcet's disease (BD) is a multisystemic vasculitis
Vascular involvement in BD is frequent and venous thrombosis is the most common manifestation (30% of cases)
The latter is often severe and considered as a life threatening complication
Pathogenesis of thrombosis occurring in BD remains unclear

We report a 45-year-old man, from south of Tunisia, who presented a BD with a bifocal arterial involvement: right internal carotid thrombosis and bilateral proximal thrombosis of the two pulmonary arteries
Therapeutic strategies to address this multiple arterial involvement and the pathogenesis of thrombosis raise many questions
